input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with CARASIL - [cerebral autosomal recessive arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy] syndrome

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 45-YEAR-OLD MALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Gait disturbances, feeling unsteady when walking
- Low back pain that has gradually worsened over the past few months
- Memory problems and difficulty concentrating, which have been slowly developing over the last year
- Hair thinning and patchy alopecia that started about two years ago
- Occasional mild strokes, with transient weakness on the right side that comes and goes
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
The gait issues began subtly about six months ago, with me feeling more off-balance when I walk, especially on uneven surfaces. My back pain gradually worsened over the past year, and I started noticing my hair thinning in patches around that same time. Over the last year, I've also struggled more with forgetfulness and confusion, which worries me because my father had similar issues. I experienced a couple of brief strokes with weakness on my right side, but they resolved quickly. I know my family history includes relatives with similar problems, and I wonder if this could be related to something genetic.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but also just enough so the doctor understands what's been bothering me. I should mention the main things first—walking issues, back pain, memory problems—and may
ANSWER: Well, I’m a 45-year-old guy, and I guess I’ve just been feeling kinda off lately. I’ve been having trouble walking steadily, like I’m unsteady and off-balance more than before. My back’s been hurting more over the past year, and I’ve noticed I’m losing some hair in patches, which I think started around the same time. Also, my memory and concentration are worse, and I’ve had a couple of brief episodes where I felt weak on one side, but they went away quickly. It’s been kind of scary, especially because my dad had some similar issues.
thinking: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but also just enough so the doctor understands what's been bothering me. I should mention the main things first—walking issues, back pain, memory problems—and may
answer: Well, I’m a 45-year-old guy, and I guess I’ve just been feeling kinda off lately. I’ve been having trouble walking steadily, like I’m unsteady and off-balance more than before. My back’s been hurting more over the past year, and I’ve noticed I’m losing some hair in patches, which I think started around the same time. Also, my memory and concentration are worse, and I’ve had a couple of brief episodes where I felt weak on one side, but they went away quickly. It’s been kind of scary, especially because my dad had some similar issues.
